[quote=“reyx7, post:10, topic:425354”][quote author=t4 link=topic=528017.msg3849902#msg3849902 date=1323921460]

POLITICO

National Defense Authorization Act passes House, 283-136

The National Defense Authorization Act and its controversial provisions regarding detention of terror suspects passed the House of Representatives Wednesday night, 283-136.


[/quote]

You’re fucking kidding me. This is ACTUALLY getting passed. Atleast I’m a white, teenage male . If this bill is based purely off of suspicion, I’m in the ‘safe’ category.[/quote]
don’t know whats that has to do with being safe

item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

reyx7:

Old news. Passed in the Senate 93-7, the Whitehouse and HOR can override it on a 2-1 majority, even on such an extreme case. It also violates the constitution, in which EVERYONE allowed a trial is innocent until proven guilty in a court of law.

O shi

AND CLEAN OUT UR INBOX GOD DAMNIT

item.title: Bill 93-7
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:

[quote=“reyx7, post:10, topic:425354”][quote author=t4 link=topic=528017.msg3849902#msg3849902 date=1323921460]

POLITICO

National Defense Authorization Act passes House, 283-136

The National Defense Authorization Act and its controversial provisions regarding detention of terror suspects passed the House of Representatives Wednesday night, 283-136.


[/quote]

You’re fucking kidding me. This is ACTUALLY getting passed. Atleast I’m a white, teenage male. If this bill is based purely off of suspicion, I’m in the ‘safe’ category.

Is there an extreme override in which the whitehouse can shoot down a bill even if supported by over 66% of both the house & Senate? Obama won’t see another term if he passes this.[/quote]
You’re a teenage male, and therefor an Anarchist.

item.description:

[quote=“reyx7, post:10, topic:425354”][quote author=t4 link=topic=528017.msg3849902#msg3849902 date=1323921460]

POLITICO

National Defense Authorization Act passes House, 283-136

The National Defense Authorization Act and its controversial provisions regarding detention of terror suspects passed the House of Representatives Wednesday night, 283-136.


[/quote]

You’re fucking kidding me. This is ACTUALLY getting passed. Atleast I’m a white, teenage male. If this bill is based purely off of suspicion, I’m in the ‘safe’ category.

Is there an extreme override in which the whitehouse can shoot down a bill even if supported by over 66% of both the house & Senate? Obama won’t see another term if he passes this.[/quote]
Umm not so sure. The media doesn’t seem to be all hyped up about it or else I would be hearing stories from kids of what their parents said at school. I don’t think he will be re elected, but I don’t think this was the big decider or will really affect his chances of being re elected that much.

a:

Every person born outside Canada after 15 February 1977, who has a Canadian parent at the time of birth, is automatically a Canadian citizen by descent. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canadian_nationality_law#Canadian_citizenship_by_descent)

that is me. mother was born in winnipeg, manitoba.
